thread.title: Diver removes fake skeletons from Colorado River as revenge
thread.title_full: Albuquerque Journal | Diver removes fake skeletons from Colorado River as revenge

author: Associated Press
title: Diver removes fake skeletons from Colorado River as revenge
text:
PARKER, Ariz. — A man in far west Arizona has removed two fake skeletons sitting in lawn chairs from the Colorado River as revenge for not being credited as the one who discovered them.
Martin Sholl tells Today’s News-Herald ( http://bit.ly/1KAJz0A) that he is the diver who found the two skeletons in the river near Parker this May. The skeletons had been tethered to lawn chairs and dressed in silly clothing, sitting on the river bottom.
Sholl says he pulled the pair from the river on Friday, placing them instead in his yard in Parker.
Sholl says he was upset when the story of the skeletons went all over the media with no mention of him, instead focusing on a La Paz County sheriff’s official.
He says he will return the skeletons after Halloween.
___
Information from: Today’s News-Herald, http://www.havasunews.com
